column4: I am not under Users and Groups for some reason. Does anyone know how to fix this? I have a home directory and applications recognize me as a user but the users and groups admin tool does not have me and the login screen does not display me.
which user and group do you mean ?
Sytem -> administration -> users and groups. The one thats installed by default.
if you open a terminal -> Applications -> Accessories - > Terminal and type "id"
you will see what all user and groups the user belongs to
that looks good enough, though you are not there in the admin group so you might not be able to do "sudo" commands
I can do sudo commands. Everything works fine except I can't edit myself with that tool or appear on the login window.
I can edit my settings through the terminal I just want to know why I am invisable to these tools.
hmm how did you add the user ? during installation or after that ?
Before actually. I had the user and home directory already when I installed ubuntu and just went on using it from there. I had originally created it during instalation when I had ubuntu before that.
could be that some of the user specific files did not get copied, during installation, just a wild guess
I have my home directories installed in a seperate partitions for when I decide to distro hop.
Is there a way to fix this?
I had did a fix for one of ma friends, trying to figure what I had actually done
If I delete the user and then recreate it with the same directory would I still have all my files?
thats risky it is based on what command you do to delete the user
dont use -r, that would delete the home directory also
